Brother Lord is a converted man and as firm as a rock to principle. He asked his employer for a recognition of his twenty years of service. Had he made one mistake? Had he been unfaithful in the least? They readily said that he had not. Then why not allow him a pension, as they had others who had served no longer? They refused him this, but said that if he would work 


                                  -138- 

on the Sabbath, he should have his place and three pounds seventeen shillings a week. But if he left them, he must expect nothing.
